title: How to Make S'more Rolls

steps.headline: Add the yeast and warm water into a medium bowl.
steps.description: Allow the yeast to create foam in the bowl and for it to activate.

steps.headline: Pour the yeast mixture into a stand mixer.
steps.description: Knead the yeast with the bread flour, white cake mix, vanilla extract, and salt. Combine everything together for about a minute.

steps.headline: Move the dough to a large greased bowl.
steps.description: Use plastic wrap on top of the bowl and allow the dough to rise to double its size for about an hour.

steps.headline: Punch the dough.
steps.description: Use your fists to punch the dough down in the bowl. Re-cover the bowl with wrap and allow the dough to re-rise again to double its size for another hour.

steps.headline: Move the dough to a floured surface or counter.
steps.description: Use a floured rolling pin to spread the dough out into a large rectangle.

parts.name: Add the Filling and Make the Rolls

steps.headline: Butter the dough.
steps.description: Use a rubber spatula to cover the dough with the softened butter. Run the spatula around the edges and inside, distributing a thin layer of butter.

steps.headline: Spread the brown sugar on top.
steps.description: Use the the spatula to lightly cover the brown sugar on top of the butter. You can also use your hand if the dough starts to tear.

steps.headline: Sprinkle the s'more ingredients.
steps.description: Spread the graham cracker crumbs, chocolate chips, and mini marshmallows as layers on top of the brown sugar.

steps.headline: Create the roll.
steps.description: Start with the side furthest from you, rolling the dough towards you into a snail-like log. Cut the roll into slices.

steps.headline: Add the slices to greased 9"x13" (23 x 33 cm) baking pans.
Cover the pans with plastic wrap.
steps.description: Allow a third rise for 30 minutes.

steps.headline: Bake the rolls for 15 to 20 minutes at 350ºF (180ºC).
Make the frosting.
steps.description: Whip the frosting ingredients together in a small bowl. Test the consistency to your liking. Start with 3 tablespoons of milk and add more to thin the frosting. Use 2 cups of powdered sugar and add another half cup to a cup to make it more thick.

steps.headline: Drizzle the frosting on top of the hot rolls.

tyn: Plastic wrap, such as Saran wrap
text: Make the Dough Add the yeast and warm water into a medium bowl. Allow the yeast to create foam in the bowl and for it to activate. Pour the yeast mixture into a stand mixer. Knead the yeast with the bread flour, white cake mix, vanilla extract, and salt. Combine everything together for about a minute. Move the dough to a large greased bowl. Use plastic wrap on top of the bowl and allow the dough to rise to double its size for about an hour. Punch the dough. Use your fists to punch the dough down in the bowl. Re-cover the bowl with wrap and allow the dough to re-rise again to double its size for another hour. Move the dough to a floured surface or counter. Use a floured rolling pin to spread the dough out into a large rectangle. Add the Filling and Make the Rolls Butter the dough. Use a rubber spatula to cover the dough with the softened butter. Run the spatula around the edges and inside, distributing a thin layer of butter. Spread the brown sugar on top. Use the the spatula to lightly cover the brown sugar on top of the butter. You can also use your hand if the dough starts to tear. Sprinkle the s'more ingredients. Spread the graham cracker crumbs, chocolate chips, and mini marshmallows as layers on top of the brown sugar. Create the roll. Start with the side furthest from you, rolling the dough towards you into a snail-like log. Cut the roll into slices. Bake and Frost the Rolls Add the slices to greased 9"x13" (23 x 33 cm) baking pans.  Cover the pans with plastic wrap. Allow a third rise for 30 minutes. Bake the rolls for 15 to 20 minutes at 350ºF (180ºC).  Make the frosting. Whip the frosting ingredients together in a small bowl. Test the consistency to your liking. Start with 3 tablespoons of milk and add more to thin the frosting. Use 2 cups of powdered sugar and add another half cup to a cup to make it more thick. Drizzle the frosting on top of the hot rolls.
sentences: Make the Dough Add the yeast and warm water into a medium bowl.
Allow the yeast to create foam in the bowl and for it to activate.
Pour the yeast mixture into a stand mixer.
Knead the yeast with the bread flour, white cake mix, vanilla extract, and salt.
Combine everything together for about a minute.
Move the dough to a large greased bowl.
Use plastic wrap on top of the bowl and allow the dough to rise to double its size for about an hour.
Punch the dough.
Use your fists to punch the dough down in the bowl.
Re-cover the bowl with wrap and allow the dough to re-rise again to double its size for another hour.
Move the dough to a floured surface or counter.
Use a floured rolling pin to spread the dough out into a large rectangle.
Add the Filling and Make the Rolls Butter the dough.
Use a rubber spatula to cover the dough with the softened butter.
Run the spatula around the edges and inside, distributing a thin layer of butter.
Spread the brown sugar on top.
Use the the spatula to lightly cover the brown sugar on top of the butter.
You can also use your hand if the dough starts to tear.
Sprinkle the s'more ingredients.
Spread the graham cracker crumbs, chocolate chips, and mini marshmallows as layers on top of the brown sugar.
Create the roll.
Start with the side furthest from you, rolling the dough towards you into a snail-like log.
Cut the roll into slices.
Bake and Frost the Rolls Add the slices to greased 9"x13" (23 x 33 cm) baking pans.
Cover the pans with plastic wrap.
Allow a third rise for 30 minutes.
Bake the rolls for 15 to 20 minutes at 350ºF (180ºC).
Make the frosting.
Whip the frosting ingredients together in a small bowl.
Test the consistency to your liking.
Start with 3 tablespoons of milk and add more to thin the frosting.
Use 2 cups of powdered sugar and add another half cup to a cup to make it more thick.
Drizzle the frosting on top of the hot rolls.
